title: Public Records Request: Data on 51A & 51B Reports Filed 2018-2023

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request: Data on 51A & 51B Reports Filed 2018-2023
communications.communication:
Steven Treat, Primary RAO
Department of Children & Families
600 Washington St, 6th Fl
Boston, MA 02111

Dear Steven:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M.G.L. c. 66, §10, for public records in the custody of your organization. The Center for Public Interest Advocacy & Collaboration, an educational, research, and advocacy organization at Northeastern University School of Law, is seeking these records for the purpose of producing publicly available interdisciplinary research and data analysis on important social issues.

We request the following public records, as defined in M.G.L. c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1.	Counts of 51A reports filed in 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023, broken down by
         a.	Fiscal year
                  i.	Area office
                           1.	Screening decision
                           2.	Category of reporter (mandated or non-mandated) 
                           3.	Category of mandated reporter (educational, medical, etc.) 
                           4.	Placement of reported children (in-home or out-of-home)
                           5.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
                           6.	Race/ethnicity of the child
                           7.	Age of the child 
                           8.	Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child 
                           9.	Disability status of the child 
                           10.	Repeat reports: number of repeat reports for the same child or family.
                           11.	Child's school status (attending school, dropout, etc.).
2.	Counts of 51B reports filed in 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, and 2023 broken down by
         a.	Fiscal year
                  i.	Area office
                           1.	Response decision
                           2.	Type of abuse or neglect alleged 
                           3.	Race/ethnicity of the child
                           4.	Age of the child 
                           5.	Sexual orientation and gender identity of the child 
                           6.	Disability status of the child 
                           7.	Placement outcome: resulting placement decision (return to home, foster care, group home)
                           8.	Previous DCF involvement: prior history of DCF involvement with the child or family.

Please provide public records in electronic format unless the record is not available in electronic format. M.G.L. c. 66, § 6A(d). If possible, we ask that you provide the requested information in Excel format. If it cannot be produced via Excel, please contact me to discuss alternatives.

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). In the event that there are fees, we would be grateful if you would provide an estimate for the total charges before fulfilling the request.

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein are not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please outline in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions you believe apply. To the extent that the records must be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withhold them in their entirety.

Please contact me if you have any questions about this request or need additional time to respond. Thank you in advance for your prompt response.

Sincerely,

Norrie Osgood
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy & Collaboration
Northeastern University School of Law
osgood.n@northeastern.edu

title: FOIA - FBI - Skatopia

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FOIA - FBI - Skatopia
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records relating to or mentioning Skatopia - an infamous skate park and community living space located in Ohio, founded and operating since 1995 (see: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skatopia)

Please also make sure to conduct a thorough search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices - for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. 

The skate park is located at 34961 Hutton Rd in Rutland, OH 45775

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

J Ader

title: FOIA Requests (Occupational Safety and Health Administration)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am searching for any and all documents regarding, evidencing, or detailing violations, warnings, cautions, fines, penalties, judgments, agency determinations, and/or enforcement inspections against the following entities at any time from 1972 to present:

-	BNSF Railway 
-	Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway
-	Burlington Northern Railroad
-	St. Louis–San Francisco Railway

This requests specifically seeks, but is not limited to, any records regarding violations, warnings, cautions, fines, testing, inspection, citations, survey work, agency recommendations/plans of action, or any communications with the above-named entity(-ies) regarding or related to violations of air quality, pollution, waste disposal, respiratory protection, workplace safety, and asbestos-related standards.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin LaMarca

title: Eric Bernay

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Eric Bernay
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Eric Irvin Bernay (March 25, 1906 - November 2, 1968); files 100-HQ-26981 and 100-NY-40164 are associated with Bernay. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago. 

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Martin and Mitchell Defection

communications.communication:

FBI files 62-HQ-106214 and 65-NY-18236 on the September 1960 defection of National Security Agency employees William Hamilton Martin (May 27, 1931 - January 17, 1987) and Bernon Ferguson Mitchell (March 11, 1929 - November 12, 2001). Proof of death is not required as their deaths have been previously reported: https://web.archive.org/web/20131227190422/http://www.seattleweekly.com/home/887442-129/story.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: 911 Call to SLMPD 7/13/24

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: 911 Call to SLMPD 7/13/24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

The recording and transcript/log of the 911 call made to St Louis Metropolitan Police Department on the evening of Saturday, July 13, 2024, at approximately 9:48pm regarding a driver who reported being harassed by other drivers while commuting from North St Louis City to South St Louis City along the streets of Union, Kingshighway and Chippewa.

Please provide all responsive records as electronic email attachments. I would expect the responsive 911 call recording to be provided in an easily accessible digital audio file format such as WAV or MP3. I prefer the 911 call transcript/log be attached as an Excel or CSV file. Please also provide documents sufficient to show explanation of all codes included on the 911 Call Transcript or 911 Call Log. Please include the following details in responsive records. 

Complaint/Event/Incident Number
Date/Time of call
Location of the call
Description of the event/incident
Instructions given to caller by the dispatcher
Event/incident data, and any other results of service
Whether police response was sent 
•	If so, please provide follow data for police response
Event/Incident disposition
 
Please also include the following details for the 911 call:
•	Call Code
•	Priority Code
•	Disposition Code
 
I am NOT seeking names of individuals or any other personally identifiable information that might violate privacy protections. However, I will accept all documents subject to disclosure per Missouri Sunshine Laws and Public Records Laws.  

As the records sought detail activities of citizens of the St Louis community who are governed by the City of St Louis and served by St Louis Metropolitan Police Department, I also request that fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public’s interest.  Increasing the public’s knowledge of SLMPD’s process for the collection, retention, dissemination and providing public access to records/documents related to public safety incidents contributes significantly to public understanding of our government’s operations.  I am seeking the records to analyze, inform and freely release to members of the public as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com. The requested records are not for commercial use.

I am a member of the public and requesting documents specifically for the purpose of increasing the public’s knowledge of governmental functions, I will administratively appeal any denial of my request for a fee waiver.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment.  

Per Section 610.024, RSMo, “If a public record contains material which is not exempt from disclosure as well as material which is exempt from disclosure, the public governmental body shall separate the exempt and nonexempt material and make the nonexempt material available for examination and copying.”

If portions of the requested documents/records are closed due to exemption, please segregate the closed portions and provide me with all segregable portions of the documents/records. If your agency maintains that exemptions apply, I also request that you please provide a detailed justification for each redaction or omission, and cite the specific exemption used for each redacted or omitted portion of the original document/records.

This request is distinctly separate from any other. Please do not combine this request with any other request in your reply.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

title: New York City Crime Analysis Center – Memorandum of Understanding

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York City Crime Analysis Center – Memorandum of Understanding
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the Division's executed Memorandum(s) of Understanding (MOU's) for cross-agency work in the New York City Crime Analysis Center (presently located at 250 Vesey Street).

Any MOU entered or contemplated by the Division of Criminal Justice Services for work with other agencies at this location should be considered responsive.  This request is inclusive of all documents that function as supplements, appendices, post-scripts, or amendments. 

These records are noted in the DCJS's Freedom of Information Subject Matter Listing as "Crime Analysis Center Network Records" under the subheading of the "Office of Crime Analysis & Strategic Partnerships."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York City Crime Analysis Center – Memorandum of Understanding
communications.communication:
Dear T. McElwee:

This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on July 16, 2024. The request was for “A copy of the Division's executed Memorandum(s) of Understanding (MOU's) for cross-agency work in the New York City Crime Analysis Center (presently located at 250 Vesey Street).”



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,


Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

title: Trump Butler PA Rally (Central Intelligence Agency)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All communication records pertaining to the incident, generated on July 13 2024 until the date this request is processed. Please include all transcripts, memoranda, and other communications in your search. Please limit your search to the following keywords: “Crooks” “assassination” “shooter” “rally” “Trump.” Responsive records would include all relevant internal memoranda, plans, reports, and email correspondence sent to and from the agency’s top five senior-most officials related to, mentioning or generated as a result of the assassination attempt. 
2. All relevant internal memoranda, plans, reports, and email correspondence sent to and from the members of your agency and members of the following organizations: Butler Township Police Department, Butler Sheriff’s Office, the Pennsylvania State Police, Pennsylvania Criminal Intelligence Center, Delaware Valley Intelligence Center (Philadelphia, PA), and Western Pennsylvania All Hazards Fusion Center (Pittsburgh, PA) containing the following keywords: “Crooks” “assassination” “shooter” “rally” “ear” “Trump.”

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $10. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest.
The release of the information is for non-commercial purposes. I am a researcher for Insider, a news organization based in New York City, whose mission is journalism in the public interest. This request is for news gathering purposes. I, or my colleagues at Business Insider, will use the records to inform the public through our reporting. I therefore request a waiver of all fees and charges pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 

In conducting your search, please use the most recent technologies and tools available. 
If any part of our request is determined by your organization to be exempt from disclosure, please release any segregable non-exempt portions. If your organization determines that such segregation is impossible, please indicate why this is technically the case. If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Freedom of Information Act. If you claim such an exemption to my request under the Freedom of Information Act, please cite in writing the specific statutory exemption. I reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees. 
Please produce these records in the electronic format (such as excel file (.xlsx) or other database form, or as .pdfs) and share them with me via email at nparakul@insider.com, if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Beckler

title: White Forms, School Absentee Reports

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: White Forms, School Absentee Reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

On June 27, 2024 in a letter to the Public Access Counselor (attached), Chicago Police Department indicated, "CPD Officers in each of the Districts are responsible to fill out school absentee reports, which are hand written on a carbon duplicate forms. Each form has a white and pink copy. Each report is a hard, paper copy and is not electronic. Each completed report is then sent to the Youth Investigations Division under the CPD Bureau of Detectives (BOD) through interoffice mail. Youth Investigation retains the 'pink copy' of the duplicate form and mails the 'white copy' to the Chicago Board of Education at 42 W. Madison Street."

Provide all school absentee reports (CPD-24.116 forms) received by CPS from January 1, 2024 to current.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

title: Transfer, by Race

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Transfer, by Race
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Anonymized data of all school transfers of CPS students for school year 2023-2024 to date broken down by race. These records should include a unique non-identifiable code for the student, race, the original school, the receiving school, and the month and year of transfer. 

Include the transfer code in the above-requested data table:

1. 33 - Transfer Outside of Chicago
2. 86 - Unable to Locate
3. 31 - Transfer within CPS
4. 32- Transfer to non-public
5. 52 - Program Ended, PreK or K
6. 40 - Homeschooled
7. 35 - Legally Committed to an Institution
8. 87 - 17 or >, Cons to Wthd

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Mayor's Office - Retrun to Office "RTO" email 1/1/24-7/14/24
communications.communication:
THE CITY OF PHILADELPHIA      Re: Mayor's Office - Retrun to Office "RTO" email 1/1/24-7/14/24    Your receipt number is: 28701  Dear 168915-87627804@requests. muckrock. com, 
   
 Thank you for your correspondence.  This is an automatic email confirming that your correspondence has been entered into our case management system for processing and response. If you have an additional request you wish to file, or if you wish to make a change to a pending request, please email it directly to righttoknowlaw@.phila.gov.     Did you know that the City already releases a lot of information and open data online?  You might be able to find the answer to your inquiry right now!   
   
 
Here are some common types of requests we receive and where to find this information online right now:  
 
 Search for a property's L&I related permits, licenses, violations, and appeals with the L&I property history tool.  
 
 Search for a property's Real Estate Tax Balance with the Revenue Department's tax real estate lookup tool.  
 
 Find all of the City of Philadelphia's open data sets, including City employee salary data, on Open Data Philly, the Philadelphia region's open data portal.  
 
 Search information about professional service contracts online at eContract Philly.  
 
 Search information about procurement contracts online with PHL Contracts.  
 
 Search City legislation and related hearings online with Legistar.  
 
 Obtain financial disclosure forms from the Department of Records.  
 
 
   If you seek a police incident report, you can obtain the proper form from the Department of Records.  Please note that police incident reports cost $25.      If you seek audio, visual, or bodycam records from the Philadelphia Police Department, you will need to make a request following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. Sec. 67A03 at https://www.legis.state.pa.us/cfdocs/legis/LI/consCheck.cfm?txtType=HTM&ttl=42&div=0&chpt=67A. Such requests must be made in-person or via 
certified mail following the instructions in 42 Pa.C.S.A. §  67A(3) (aka
 Act 22). Such requests are not processed under the RTKL. See 42 Pa.C.S.A. § 67A(2)(a); 65 P.S. §§ 67.305, 67.3101.1. You may use this form to make a request under Act 22. Requests under Act 22  should be addressed to: Lieutenant Barry Jacobs, Philadelphia Police Department, Open Records/Right to Know Section, Philadelphia Public Services Building, 400 N. Broad St., 4W-72, Philadelphia, PA 19130. Such requests are not processed under the Right-to-Know Law.       Use the forms on this page to request copies of various public safety from the Department of Records, such as:   
 Traffic Accident Reports (aka "crash report" - also available through https://public-safety-reports.phila.gov/)  A records check or letter of good conduct from the Philadelphia Police Department  Fire Reports  Emergency Medical Services Reports       The City of Philadelphia does not process Right-to-Know requests for the organizations listed below.  If you want to submit a request to one of these entities, please click the links below to be directed to their Open Records Policies:   
 
Philadelphia Parking Authority  
 
 
School District of Philadelphia  
 
 
City of Philadelphia District Attorney’s Office  
 
 
Philadelphia Redevelopment Authority  
 
 
First Judicial District (Philadelphia Court of Common Pleas)  
 
 
   If one of these sources has solved your inquiry, please let us know!  Otherwise, thank you for your patience, and we will be in touch soon.   Sincerely,   The City of Philadelphia  Please Note: To help make sure that future emails from us don't end up in your spam or junk folder, please add this email address to your safe sender list.

RE: CPRA REQUEST of July 14, 2024, Reference # R005367-071424 Dear Mr. Moran, The California Highway Patrol received a CPRA REQUEST from you on July 14, 2024. Your request mentioned: 
“To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. Duty and attendance records for the officer associated with badge number 15830 from June 1, 2024, to the present date. 
2. Any records or reports indicating their current leave of absence status. 
3. Any incident reports related to their stolen personal belongings, if applicable." 
Please be advised, the CHP does not have a centralized database capable of searching for or producing the records you are seeking statewide. In order to conduct asearch of records, please provide specific information for items 1 and 3 such as search location, CHP Area office, date range of report, description of stolen personal belongs, or any additional information. If you would like for the California Highway Patrol to proceed with your California Public Records Act request, please provide the requested information.  You may provide a response to the California Highway Patrol by replying to this email. If you have any questions or need additional information, please respond to this email or contact the PRU at (916) 843-4030. Sincerely, 
Katelynn Coble 
California Highway Patrol 
Public Records Unit

title: FBI: BTCBOT.IO

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: BTCBOT.IO
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any bureau records regarding the website and automated sales services offered by www.btcbot.io. 

In recent months, a significant number of web domains have been registered. Simple websites (often using web domains associated with American companies such as Uber) are heavily promoted and provide links to Telegram accounts which are offering the drug Mephedrone for sale in the country of Georgia. While this company offers services which appear to facilitate the sale of illicit drugs outside of the United States, a significant number of United States companies (such as Cloudflare) are providing the infrastructure that assists this activity.  

The website is located at: https://btcbot.io/ looks to be an automated tool that assists connecting websites to Telegram accounts to drug sales. This is, therefore, a formal request for bureau investigative records related to btcbot.io. 

Bureau records related to btcbot.io might include: correspondence with Cloudflare regarding services offered to btcbot.io or affiliated websites, correspondence with SAREK (https://sarek.fi/about/) the registrar with btcbot.io or correspondence to or from the International Operations Division of FBI Headquarters regarding btcbot.io or websites and Telegram accounts found to utilize btcbot.io's services. 

If https://btcbot.io/ is under Bureau investigation, please do not deny the entire request and release any information available under the law. If you cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the bureau's transparency regarding btcbot.io.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Harrison Homes Permits at Prairie View Ranch

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Harrison Homes Permits at Prairie View Ranch
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All types of permits issued by Morgan County for new roadworks, new electrical infrastructure, new water infrastructure, new transportation infrastructure, new garages/workshops, new foundations, new septic systems, and new modular home installation activities carried out at the Prairie View Ranch Planned Development from 2017 to present. The purpose of this request is to assemble a clear picture of who applied for permits, which permits were denied or approved, and who performed the permitted or denied work.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous natural person(s)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any incident reports, records, email communications, court records, investigative findings, in the matter of Robert C. Devine, Lisa Devine and Tiffany Overstreet between October 1, 2014 and January 20, 2015.

I request these records as an individual seeking information for personal use and not for commercial use.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susanne Cleveland

title: Dr. Ruth Westheimer

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Dr. Ruth Westheimer
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. 

RECORDS REQUESTED

Please produce all records related to Dr. Ruth Westheimer, the sex advice therapist. She was born in Frankfurt, Germany on June 4, 1928 and died on July 12, 2024 in Manhattan.

OTHER NAMES USED

The subject was born Karola Ruth Siegel.

PROOF OF DEATH:

Dr. Westheimer's news obituary from the Washington Post is attached.

SCOPE OF SEARCH:

In addition to standard practices, please search the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices.

FORM OF PRODUCTION

I would prefer that you produce responsive records electronically, by email attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

Thank you very much.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Transparency
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the hiring folder and all its contents for the hiring of Orleans Assistant Town manager advertised on or about November 1, 2023.
clerk@town.orleans.ma.us

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daralyn Heywood

title: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Jenniffer González Colón Letters to USACE
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents obtained through a FOIA sent to USACE's Jacksonville District, show that Jenniffer González Colón sent at least one letter to USACE in hopes of speeding up the approval of a Jurisdictional Determination (JD). The letter can be found here: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/24805241-20230315-letter-gonzalez-colon-to-usace-jax?responsive=1&title=1

Therefore I request the following:

1) Every letter that Jenniffer González Colón or her office has sent to USACE's Jacksonville District. It's likely that these letters were sent to Col. James Booth, District Commander of USACE's Jacksonville District, and/or Mr. Howard Gonzales, Deputy District Engineer for Programs and Project Management for USACE's Jacksonville District.

Keywords: "Jenniffer González Colon" "tourism" "residential" "development" "JGO" "Puerto Rico"

This request is for all documents produced between January 1, 2022 and the time this request is processed.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am an independent journalist and documents from this request will be used in the course of reporting about construction projects in Puerto Rico. https://muckrack.com/carlos-e-berrios-polanco

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Carlos Berríos Polanco

title: Completed VA Form 10-0379's

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Completed VA Form 10-0379's
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All completed VA Form 10-0379 submitted by religious faith groups to the National Chaplain Service within three years from the composition of this request (i.e., from July 12, 2021 until July 12, 2024).

This request is solely for the submitted forms themselves and not the attached paperwork. This request excludes any deliberative process paperwork. Upon information and belief, these forms have no FOIA-exempt material, and their contents should not be redacted.

Should records be voluminous, I consent in advance to a rolling release in whatever order the Department deems expedient (i.e., alphabetically, chronologically) in conveniently sized page numbers.

This request is made with the aim to educate the general public, with the specific benefit of documenting the exercise of religion among veterans, and should be exempt from fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Completed VA Form 10-0379's
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All completed VA Form 10-0379 submitted by religious faith groups to the National Chaplain Service within three years from the composition of this request (i.e., from July 12, 2021 until July 12, 2024).

This request is solely for the submitted forms themselves and not the attached paperwork. This request excludes any deliberative process paperwork. Upon information and belief, these forms have no FOIA-exempt material, and their contents should not be redacted.

Should records be voluminous, I consent in advance to a rolling release in whatever order the Department deems expedient (i.e., alphabetically, chronologically) in conveniently sized page numbers.

This request is made with the aim to educate the general public, with the specific benefit of documenting the exercise of religion among veterans, and should be exempt from fees.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

The University processes requests as promptly as possible and, generally, in the order they are received. title: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Savoy Public Schools)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Savoy Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern: 
This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department for the Savoy Public Schools. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced) for the town of Savoy. Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns: 
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
c. Charge (or charges) 
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement 
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable. 
2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0. 
5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
6. A copy of any active memorandum of agreement and/or standard operating procedures between your police department and local school districts regarding police placement or activity in schools. 
7. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and, 
8. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing, data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with M. G. L.c. 71 § 37P(b). 
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.” 
It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs. 
 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d). 
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request. 
Sincerely, 
Makayla Connor
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 
Connor.mak@northeastern.edu
(508) 340-1740

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Richmond Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern: 
This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department regarding the Richmond Public Schools.  Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced) for the town of Richmond. Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns: 
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
c. Charge (or charges) 
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement 
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable. 
2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0. 
5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
6. A copy of any active memorandum of agreement and/or standard operating procedures between your police department and local school districts regarding police placement or activity in schools. 
7. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and, 
8. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing, data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with M. G. L.c. 71 § 37P(b). 
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.” 
It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs. 
 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d). 
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request. 
Sincerely, 
Makayla Connor
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 
Connor.mak@northeastern.edu
(508) 340-1740

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor

title: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Narragansett Public Schools)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request for Data on School Policing (Narragansett Public Schools)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern: 
This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department. Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns: 
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
c. Charge (or charges) 
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement 
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school. 
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable. 
2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0. 
5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
6. A copy of any active memorandum of agreement and/or standard operating procedures between your police department and local school districts regarding police placement or activity in schools. 
7. A copy of any active standard operating procedures developed with the police department and/or other law enforcement agencies regarding police placement or activity in your corresponding school; and, 
8. Any records instructing or informing police personnel of, or otherwise describing, data reporting requirements and procedures for complying with M. G. L.c. 71 § 37P(b). 
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.” 
It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs. 
 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d). 
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety. 
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request. 
Sincerely, 
Makayla Connor
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 
Connor.mak@northeastern.edu
(508) 340-1740

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Makayla Connor
